soc.server.savegame

Class GameLoaderJSON

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.server.savegame.GameLoaderJSON

  • public class GameLoaderJSON
extends java.lang.Object
    Load a game and board's current state from a JSON file into a SavedGameModel. Once loaded, game's SOCGame.getGameState() will temporarily have state GameState.LOADING; its actual gameState will be in game's oldGameState field. Once the debug user has connected necessary bots or otherwise satisfied possible constraints, must call SavedGameModel.resumePlay(boolean) to check constraints and resume game play.

    Some fields use custom deserializers, either registered in a private method here or in SavedGameModel, or declared through @JsonAdapter field annotations in SavedGameModel.

    Since:
    2.3.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    GameSaverJSON

    • Method Detail

      • loadGame

        public static SavedGameModel loadGame(java.io.File loadFrom,
                                      SOCServer srv)
                               throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                                      SOCGameOptionVersionException,
                                      SavedGameModel.UnsupportedSGMOperationException,
                                      java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                      java.io.IOException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Load a game from a JSON file. Loads into a Model and calls SavedGameModel.createLoadedGame(SOCServer).

        Assumes caller has checked that gson jar is on classpath by calling Class.forName("com.google.gson.Gson") or similar.

        Parameters:
        loadFrom - File to load from; filename should end with GameSaverJSON.FILENAME_EXTENSION
        srv - Server reference to check for bot name collisions; not null. Any bot players in the loaded game data with same names as those logged into the server will be renamed to avoid problems during random bot assignment while joining the game.
        Returns:
        loaded game model
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if file's model schema version is newer than the current SavedGameModel.MODEL_VERSION; see SavedGameModel.checkCanLoad(SOCGameOptionSet) for details
        SOCGameOptionVersionException - if loaded data's #gameMinVersion field is newer than the server's Version.versionNumber(); see SavedGameModel.checkCanLoad(SOCGameOptionSet) for details
        SavedGameModel.UnsupportedSGMOperationException - if loaded game model has an option or feature not yet supported by SavedGameModel.createLoadedGame(SOCServer); see SavedGameModel.checkCanLoad(SOCGameOptionSet) for details
        java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if a JsonSyntaxException occurs while loading, this wraps it so the caller doesn't need to know GSON-specific exception types
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while loading, including a JsonIOException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there's a problem while creating the loaded game. Throwable.getCause() will have the exception thrown by the SOCGame/SOCPlayer method responsible. Catch subclass SOCGameOptionVersionException before this one. Also thrown if srv is null.
